alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 4:44PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Big Horn County through 515 PM MDT... At 444 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northeast of Crow Agency, or 21 miles east of Hardin, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail, along with very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Localized low land flooding is possible due to heavy rainfall. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Big Horn County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
